lines.text: You don't like him because he's so outspoken. You don't like his manners. Isn't that it?
No, that's not it. It, its his, smile. It's like a man-eating shark with a bible under his fin.
I don't like him. I never shall.
You never tried to.
Oh, it isn't that. There's something, clammy about him. I can't explain it. I've had the same feeling, brushing against something on a dark night.
This is our destiny, my dear.
I know. What have we done to these people of yours, Nicky, that they'd hate us so,
Nothing, Alex. Everybody loves you, you know that.
No. But, you love me, Nicky. That's enough for any Empress.
Whose in charge of the boy, you or me?
I am in charge of his highness' German lessons.
Clear out!
I shall report this to her Majesty.
Get out, you kraut-head! You dried up sausage!
I need you.
Yes, your Majesty.
I've injured you. But, I've injured Russia more.
Your Majesty, I know how much you love Russia. Everything in your heart, everything that you've done, you thought was for Russia's good.
My heart is broken. What are we to do?
This is another century, Igor. What you have done has put us back 20 years in the eyes of Europe.
My dear, Empress. Or, would you rather be called Kaiserina
Igor!
The, eh, last Empress Germany gave us, Catherine, was usually called the Great.
Paul!
Majesty! Your lordship, look at him!
What's the matter with him?
Why, he's frightened, naturally. It's alright my boy, go to your mother. Don't be afraid. He won't hurt me.
Look at his eyes!
What's the matter with his eyes?
Is it because he wasn't glad to see you? What do you say to your mother, lordship?
I love you mamushka.
I love you darling.
